title: ePub
synopsis: EPUB (short for electronic publication; sometimes styled ePub) is a free and open e-book standard by the International Digital Publishing Forum (IDPF). Files have the extension .epub - [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/EPUB wikipedia]

title: .ncx
synopsis: The NCX file (Navigation Control file for XML), traditionally named toc.ncx, contains the hierarchical table of contents for the [[EPUB]] file - [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/EPUB#Open_Packaging_Format_2.0.1 wikipedia]

title: Open Container Format
synopsis: An EPUB file is a group of files that conform to the OPS/OPF standards and are wrapped in a ZIP file. The OCF specifies how to organize these files in the ZIP, and defines two additional files that must be included.

title: .opf
synopsis: The OPF file, traditionally named content.opf, houses the [[EPUB]] book's metadata, file manifest, and linear reading order.

title: PageMaps
synopsis: PageMaps is a structured data format that Google created to enable website creators to embed data and notes in their webpages - [https://support.google.com/customsearch/answer/1628213 support.google.com]

title: Responsive Images
synopsis: [[Picturefill 2.0]] is a near a perfect polyfill for responsive images. Here we explain exactly how we can use the upcoming [[<picture>]] element and [[srcset]], with simple fallbacks for legacy browsers.

title: Sitemap
synopsis: [[Sitemap]]s are an easy way for webmasters to inform search engines about pages on their sites that are available for crawling - [http://www.sitemaps.org/ sitemaps.org]

title: Welcome Visitors
synopsis: Here on the [[Himalayan Academy]] we are exploring in particular issues regarding [[Image Optimisation]], [[ePub]] processing and web integration.
